intro: Tovomita nervosa, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. Its roots and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Botanically, it is notable for its unique morphology and ecological adaptations to its native environment.
